results.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2011
results.brief_description: Harry, Ron and Hermione continue their quest to vanquish the evil Voldemort once and for all. Just as things begin to look hopeless for the young wizards, Harry discovers a trio of magical objects that endow him with powers to rival Voldemort’s formidable skills.
results.title_for_label: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2011

results.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010
results.brief_description: Harry, Ron and Hermione walk away from their last year at Hogwarts to find and destroy the remaining Horcruxes, putting an end to Voldemort’s bid for immortality. But with Voldemort’s Death Eaters on the loose, the world is more dangerous than ever.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

constellations_other.name: Shadowplay and spookiness
constellations_other.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

results.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
results.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
results.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

results.title: Harry Potter and the chamber of secrets
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, David Heyman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The second instalment in the Harry Potter series returns to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, in what is arguably a stronger film than its predecessor, despite belief that the novel on which the film is based, is the weakest in the series. An enchanting musical score and solid animation are supported by strong performances of young actors Daniel Radcliff, Emma Watson and Rupert Grint, who reprise their roles as Harry, Hermione and Ron. Between dealing with cryptic house-elves, flying cars, Quidditch, and attempting to keep one step ahead of the nasty Slytherins, who has time to study? However, when muggle-born students are being attacked, it is once again up to Harry and his friends to save the day. The all-star British cast includes Jason Isaacs as the malicious Lucius Malfoy and Kenneth Branagh as pompous professor Gilderoy Lockhart who join Richard Harris, in one of his final roles, Maggie Smith, Alan Rickman, Robbie Coltrane, John Cleese, Fiona Shaw, Zoe Wanamaker, Julie Walters, John Hurt, Ian Hart, Richard Griffiths and Warwick Davis. Based on the novel by J.K. Rowling.

results.title: Harry Butler's Tasmania
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Harry Butler takes us on a journey through Tasmania’s unique parks and open areas, highlighting the love of getting away from it all.

results.title: Harry Bachelor
results.brief_description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?

results.title: Harry and Walter go to New York
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Don Devlin, Harry Gittes, Tony Bill, Columbia and Safecracker Productions
results.brief_description: This comedy caper film set in the 1890’s (the period meticulously re-created by art director Harry Horner) features James Caan and Elliot Gould as a vaudeville song and dance team who, after being thrown into jail on a petty theft charge make the acquaintance of a big time crook (Michael Caine). Together they devise a plot to execute a major bank robbery - with disastrous results. Cast also includes Diane Keaton.
